Key Match Events: Florian Wirtz scored the opening goal from 30 yards out, rifling his shot into the top corner of Brice Samba’s goal.
Jamal Musiala rounded Samba before cutting the ball back for Kai Havertz to score Germany’s second goal.
France struggled to gain a foothold in the game with a lack of intensity and technical errors, conceding possession to Germany.
Post-Match Reflections: Boos rang around the stadium at full-time; not the ideal preparation for this summer’s tournament in Germany.
Deschamps’ side had just 32% possession after 17 minutes of the first half.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Didier Deschamps managed his 150th game for France.
Kylian Mbappé and Ousmane Dembélé were impressive in one-on-one situations but lacked the final ball.
